channel.title: #133: Why Matt Bearman chose to sell his bootstrapped product, Saber Feedback
channel.description:
Matt Bearman, original founder of Saber Feedback, discusses the experience of creating, growing, and then selling Saber Feedback.
<iframe height="200px" width="100%" frameborder="no" scrolling="no" seamless src="https://player.simplecast.com/551602ec-dfd8-4e87-ab52-885bef93e68b?dark=false"></iframe>
* Matt's Blog: https://mattbearman.svbtle.com/ * The Google Ads PPC course recommended by Matt: https://www.udemy.com/share/101XkgB0oZcFZUQHg=
Thanks to EmailToolTester who sponsored this episode. Find which email newsletter service actually reaches your customers with [EmailToolTester’s deliverability report](https://emailtooltester.com/deliver).
You can also [listen to and download this episode here](https://bootstrapped.fm/2020/05/07/133-why-matt-bearman-chose-to-sell-his-bootstrapped-product-saber-feedback/).

item.title: #133: Why Matt Bearman chose to sell his bootstrapped product, Saber Feedback
item.dc:creator: dgrigg
item.description:
@mattbearman congratulations on the sale. I followed your journey via your blog while travelling the same roads in the same market with my own product. I can appreciate every up and down you had. Thank you for your openness and transparency, it was refreshing to see someone sharing everything not just the highs. All the best on your new ventures.

Read full topic
item.source: #133: Why Matt Bearman chose to sell his bootstrapped product, Saber Feedback

item.title: #133: Why Matt Bearman chose to sell his bootstrapped product, Saber Feedback
item.dc:creator: mattbearman
item.description:
Thanks for having me on the show Steve, I really enjoyed it. If anyone has any questions about the sale feel free to ask

item.title: #133: Why Matt Bearman chose to sell his bootstrapped product, Saber Feedback
item.dc:creator: SteveMcLeod
item.description:
In this episode I also revealed my failed attempt to become an outdoors type.

My dream was to surf in the mornings and work on my product in the afternoons. But then I remember a) I don’t surf and b) I’m not a very good swimmer.

Read full topic
